intro: Leucadendron dregei, commonly known as the silver curlew, is a striking South African shrub belonging to the Proteaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, silvery-white foliage and cone-shaped flower heads, which are particularly showy during the winter months. The plant is native to the Western and Eastern Cape provinces, where it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and hardy nature. Leucadendron dregei plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for various pollinators.
